page.title: 08The Parkhouse Inn
page.content: The Parkhouse Inn, known originally as the 'Perkus' is believed to date back to the l8OO's. It provides an important recreation centre with its separate lounge and bar facilities and the old stabling block converted into a dining room. Refreshments include a choice of beers, wines and spirits, with the cost of a pint of beer being 66p and the least expensive spirit being 59p for 1/6th gill. The Inn caters for local as well as tourist trade. It provides a meeting ground for local clubs with 2 darts teams meeting on a Thursday evening throughout the Summer and Winter, with the colder months catering for crib on a Tuesday. A deep sea fishing club known as the Taverners Angling Club meets throughout the year.
